channel.title: Yuko Shimizu on jverkamp.com
channel.description: Recent content in Yuko Shimizu on jverkamp.com

item.title: The Unwritten, Vol. 11: Apocalypse
item.description:
It all comes together in the end. Pullman. Madame Puppeteer. Tom and Tommy. Savoy, Wilson, Lizzie. The Rabbit. Everyone.

And of course, for the biggest story: the Grail (and the other stories based on it and based upon it). Or is it a drum? A trumpet? The Trumpet?

And… the End.

Ish.

It’s a weird conclusion to a weird story. Fitting that way.

Worth the read.

item.title: The Unwritten, Vol. 10: War Stories
item.description:
In the beginning…

And it only gets weirder from there…

A good choice of story though.

Yup. That’s Aslan.

Of course it’s going to take quite a story to get back to the ‘real’ world from Fables… But in a good way. I’m glad to see a few older characters and more Levithan. Feels like things are really finishing off.

item.title: The Unwritten, Vol. 7: The Wound
item.description:
So very bonkers. At times, I’m pretty sure I have no idea what’s going on, which makes me feel bad for the characters. :D It’s still a wonderful fever top of a story though.

Onward!

item.title: The Unwritten, Vol. 6: Tommy Taylor and the War of Words
item.description:
The story is going now. Tommy has leaned into his powers–and his opponents are figuring out how to fight back!–we learn who/what exactly Pullman is, and Savoy really gets to do his Vampire thing.

Onward!

item.title: The Unwritten, Vol. 4: Leviathan
item.description:
Onward marches the story, ever stranger. Hints of what Tommy can (and must) do.

Onwards and upwards!

item.title: The Unwritten, Vol. 3: Dead Man's Knock
item.description: He’s on the run and–eventually–starting to accept his destiny. It’s interesting to get further into who everyone is and how the world works. I’m curious where things will go next!

item.title: The Unwritten, Vol. 2: Inside Man
item.description: Things are starting to move now! Prison, dedicated journalists, some real magic, and death. I’ll still trying to figure out the rules, but I’m enjoying it so far!

item.title: The Unwritten, Vol. 1: Tommy Taylor and the Bogus Identity
item.description:
Well that’s a start. A world where Tommy Taylor is a modern hidden world fantasy even bigger than Harry Potter… until the author disappears, leaving behind disillusioned son Tom Taylor. There are more than hints of a darker truth behind the story, hidden worlds within hidden worlds. And a section at the end establishing how far back in time the truth goes.

So far, a fascinating sort of story. Well written and illustrated. I’m willing to bet that I can guess a chunk of what’s to come, but I bet the getting there will be the best part.

Onward!
